questions.text: A 45 year old woman noticed mass in her left breast with bloody discharge. Histopathologic picture of the lesion is given below. The treatment is:
Which of the following is false about the condition shown in the picture below:

options.label: A
options.text: Thrombophlebitis of superficial veins of breast

options.label: C
options.text: Cord like appearance of subcutaneous veins

options.label: D
options.text: NSAIDs and warm compresses can produce resolution

questions.correct_answer: B. Lymphatic infiltration of tumor cell

questions.text: A child presents with a swelling as shown in the picture below. What is the probable diagnosis?

options.label: D
options.text: Mucocele of maxillary and ethmoid sinus

questions.text: The following appearance of esophagus in barium swallow is seen in which of the following conditions?
Which of the following is a true statement regarding the condition in a 40 year old male shown in the picture below:

options.label: A
options.text: It is inherited in autosomal recessive fashion

options.label: B
options.text: It is a risk factor for Renal cell carcinoma

options.label: C
options.text: It is usually caused by a single gene mutation on chromosome 16

questions.correct_answer: C. It is usually caused by a single gene mutation on chromosome 16

questions.text: What is the most likely underlying diagnosis?

A 46-year-old man presented with left lower quadrant pain, tenderness, and rebound tenderness on examination. He was afebrile and the blood tests were normal. The abdominal CT is given below. What is the most probable diagnosis?
What is the most likely diagnosis?

Identify the instrument
The instrument shown below is used in which of the following surgeries?
The painless ulcers shown here developed in a 55-year-old man with diabetes who did not recall any antecedent trauma. What type of ulcer is this?

A 34-year-old male smoker reports having rest pain and lower extremity digital ulcers for 2 months. He also reports a 1-year history of claudication. Which one of the following is the best means of preventing amputation?
A 55-year-old man had the painless lesions shown here. Biopsy reveals carcinoma in situ. What is this condition?

A 40 year old male patient presented with mild abdominal pain, mild constipation with a feeling of incomplete evacuation and mucus in stools for the past 4 years. On examination, tenderness present on left iliac fossa. Barium enema picture is given below. The most likely diagnosis is:

A 65-year-old woman presents with fatigue, right flank pain, and ankle edema. Laboratory studies show increased liver enzyme values and microscopic hematuria. The picture CT scan abdomen is given below. What is the diagnosis?
Identify the investigation used:
A child had a history of stab injury on the anterior abdominal wall and the image is shown below. The child is hemodynamically stable. Which will be the next course of treatment?
What is the instrument shown below that is used to create a pneumoperitoneum ?
A surgeon is performing an open cholecystectomy and uses the following instrument to lift the liver up. Identify the given instrument.

A patient was received in the casualty following a road traffic accident. His BP was 90/60 mmHg and his pulse rate was 120/min. The emergency room physician asked you to replace the fluid loss in this patient. What is the maximum flow rate of fluid with the IV canula given in the image?
For what purpose would you use the instrument shown in the image?

options.label: D
options.text: To hold tough tissue like skin and fascia

questions.correct_answer: A. To carry out blunt dissection

questions.text: A diabetic patient presents with sudden-onset perineal pain. On examination, foul-smelling discharge, and necrotic tissue as seen in the image is noted. Which of the following is true about the given condition?

options.label: A
options.text: Anti-gas gangrene serum indicated for all cases

options.label: B
options.text: Urinary diversion is the next step

questions.correct_answer: D. Mixed aerobic and anaerobic infection

questions.text: A peripherally Inserted central catheter line(PICC) was placed in a patient to provide parenteral nutrition. Following the insertion, a chest X-ray was taken, which appeared as shown in the image below. Which of the following is the ideal position of the tip of this catheter?

A man presented to the emergency department after RTA with complaints of chest pain and breathing difficulty. An X-ray was done and is given below. What type of breathing pattern is observed in this patient? RTA-Road Traffic Accident
The instrument given in the image is:
Which among the following statements is false regarding the instrument shown below?

options.label: A
options.text: It is the safest in procedures close to vital structures

options.label: B
options.text: It can be used for coagulation

options.label: C
options.text: It can be used for cutting

options.label: D
options.text: There is more thermal dissipation of current

questions.correct_answer: A. It is the safest in procedures close to vital structures

questions.text: The type of knot seen In the image is:
Identify the instrument:
Identify the given condition.
What is the size of the cannula shown in the below image?

A 45-year-old man is diagnosed with an indirect inguinal hernia. The surgeon uses the suture material given in the image below for the hernia repair. It is a polyamide polymer that undergoes degradation and loses tensile strength at the rate of 15-20% every year. Identify the suture material.

A young man with a history of blunt abdominal trauma was brought to the emergency department. He was hemodynamically unstable, and a FAST examination revealed free fluid. An immediate laparotomy was done. The maneuver shown in the image below was performed due to severe bleeding near the liver. However, the bleeding continued. What could be the probable source of the bleeding in this case? FAST-Focussed assessment with sonography in trauma

options.label: D
options.text: Both hepatic arterial and Portal venous bleeding

questions.text: A chronic alcoholic presents to the emergency room with bloody vomitus. Vital signs show a BP of 90/70 mm Hg, pulse 110 bpm, and SpO2-97%. Physical examination shows scleral icterus and a distended abdomen with spider nevi. The bleeding is immediately controlled using the instrument shown in the image. Identify the instrument?
Which of the following is the principle behind the wound-healing procedure shown in the image below?.
The operating surgeon performed the following suture technique on the skin after appendicectomy surgery. This is called

The procedure shown in the image below is being performed on a 35-year-old male patient, who presented with complaints of dysphagia, regurgitation, and chest pain. His barium swallow showed a bird’s beak appearance near the gastroesophageal junction. What is the procedure performed on this patient known as?

A 55-year-old male presented with verrucous carcinoma around the glans of the penis. Examination reveals that the inguinal lymph nodes are not enlarged. What is the appropriate management for this patient?
A CECT abdomen done to evaluate an elderly man with intermittent flank pain is shown below. Which of the following will be the most common site for secondary metastasis in patients with this tumor?

A 3-day-old neonate presents with abdominal distension and bilious vomiting. An erect X-ray of the abdomen is done and shown below. The neonate is taken up for surgery and an apple-peel bowel with loss of dorsal mesentery is seen. Which type of ileal atresia has this feature?
A newborn was found to have a following anomaly of the penile urethra while being examined by a pediatrician. Identify the incorrect statement regarding the condition.

options.label: A
options.text: It is the most common congenital abnormality of the urethra

options.label: B
options.text: Circumcision should be done to remove the excess skin

options.label: C
options.text: It does not cause urinary obstruction

options.label: D
options.text: Ventral chordee is a common association

questions.correct_answer: B. Circumcision should be done to remove the excess skin

questions.text: A 33-year-old female patient comes to the clinic with difficulty swallowing food and liquids for the last two months. She also complains of a sensation of food getting stuck in her throat. She has had an intermittent burning sensation in her throat and chest during the last month. Further evaluation with barium swallow shows the findings below. Which of the following is false about her condition?

options.label: A
options.text: All patients with this condition should be evaluated for psychiatric conditions

options.label: B
options.text: Aperistalsis in the oesophageal body is the characteristic feature

options.label: C
options.text: Calcium channel blockers may be tried in mildly symptomatic patients

options.label: D
options.text: This condition is seen most often in female patients

questions.correct_answer: B. Aperistalsis in the oesophageal body is the characteristic feature

questions.text: A known hypertensive presented with intermittent left-sided flank pain. His brother passed away two years ago due to a ruptured berry aneurysm. CT abdomen done is shown below. Which of the following is false regarding his condition?

options.label: A
options.text: Decompression of cyst improves renal function

questions.correct_answer: A. Decompression of cyst improves renal function

questions.text: You notice the following test is being performed by your senior on a 30-year-old patient having an Alvarado score of 7. The patient complained of pain in the right lower quadrant of the abdomen on performing the test. What is the name given to this clinical sign?
A patient with rectal prolapse underwent surgery. The postoperative image is given below. Identify the procedure.
A delayed intravenous urogram of a patient is given below. What is the likely diagnosis?
What is the appropriate age at which corrective surgery should be done for the defect shown in the image?
The instrument shown below will be least useful for examining patients with which of the following conditions?
A biopsy was obtained from a patient with chronic peptic ulcer disease. The pathological slide is given below. Identify the false statement regarding the causative agent of this condition.

options.label: B
options.text: Causes the most common type of gastritis

options.label: C
options.text: Associated with causation of gastric MALToma

options.label: D
options.text: Considered by WHO as class I carcinogen

questions.text: A 45-year-old male patient presents to the surgery OPD with epigastric pain, bloating, cough, and acid reflux. His symptoms subside slightly on taking antacids. He is being worked up for peptic ulcer disease. He has a gastric ulcer in the region of the stomach marked in the image below. What will be the type of ulcer in this case according to the Modified Johnson anatomical classification?
Which investigation is not necessary for the following condition?

A 40-year-old male presented to the OPD with complaints of abdominal pain, diarrhea, loss of appetite, and loss of weight. On examination, the patient had peripheral edema and ascites. Laboratory studies showed decreased serum albumin but normal serum levels of transaminases and gastrin. Upper GI endoscopy showed the following appearance of the stomach. Which of the following is true about the condition?

options.label: B
options.text: Gastrectomy is the treatment of choice in severe cases

options.label: C
options.text: Caused by overexpression of TNF alpha

questions.correct_answer: B. Gastrectomy is the treatment of choice in severe cases

questions.text: In a patient with abdominal pain and sterile pyuria, what is the finding shown in the image given?
What instrument is required for the following procedure?
A baby was born with a congenital defect as shown below. Which of the following statements is false regarding this condition?

options.label: B
options.text: It is due to failure of physiological hernia to reduce before 7 weeks

options.label: D
options.text: Topical application of silver nitrate is done

questions.correct_answer: B. It is due to failure of physiological hernia to reduce before 7 weeks

questions.text: A 26-year-old male patient was brought to the emergency department with abdominal pain and obstipation for 3 days. He gives a history of bull gore to the abdomen 3 days back. His X-ray is given below. What is the probable diagnosis?
You observe a patient being operated upon in the given position in the operation theatre. What could be the likely surgery being performed?
